Description: Woman's dress made of black-dyed cotton. A-line with straight sleeves, round neck and short front opening secured with plastic button. Embroidered in predomnantly pink and orange wool in vertical lines down outer panels and along sleeves. Similar embroidery on back but also along deep hem. Central front section has six diamond-shaped motifs embroidered in pink, green, blue, orange and red wool. Plastron densely embroidered in pink, green and orange wool. Further embellishred with stamped metal discs and row of tassels along bottom edge. Lined on inside of plaston with floral patterned cotton cloth.
Curator's comments: See also three Palestinian dresses from same donor 2011,6038.1-3.
Condition: Good. Some fading to black base cloth. Dress has been altered at some stage and there is evidence of this alteration in length and on sleeves.
